cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest today, then turning west tonight and moving directly toward the central/south Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to south Texas coast, likely near or just south of Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from High Island southward to the mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph gusts) expected Saturday, with highest risk during daylight hours.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible in bays and inlets around Matagorda and Lavaca Bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches expected, isolated 12 inches possible, producing flash flooding concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; brief tornadoes in outer rainbands cannot be ruled out.
